alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 1:55AM CDT until August 04 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTY... At 155 AM CDT, local law enforcement reported street flooding in Carlyle. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Carlyle, Wamac, Beckemeyer, Irvington, Shattuc, Boulder, Hoffman, Keyesport, Huey, Ferrin and Posey. This includes the following State Parks... Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
